result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Harlan D.E. Lamere was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
Count 4 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Probation may be transferred to Forest County.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation and DJOC.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #14CF340.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #14CF340

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Defendant to make an effort to obtain HSED.
-Defendant to try and obtain a job.
-Agent to provide an update 5 days prior to Probation Review Hearing.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: DF ATTY:  Joel David Schlitz   DF:  Harlan D.E. Lamere appeared by phone. Case called at 11:36. There has not been an update filed by the agent. Probation review hearing on August 16, 2315 at 11:30 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley DF ATTY: Joel David Schlitz   DF:  Harlan D.E. Lamere appeared. Case called at 2:06. Atty. McKinleyupdates the court there is an agreement. Atty. Schlitz agrees. Atty. Schlitz clarifies. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads    to Ct 3, 4, 5  in 14CF340 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 3, 4, 5 in 14CF340.  Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders:
Count 3 and 5. Sentence W/H
- 60 days condition time in jail.
   If confined, court grants Huber for work/ seek work. 
- 2 years probation concurrent  Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment by the agent. 
- Random and regular testing. 
- DE not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- DE to make efforts for HSED.
- DE to try and find a job.
- 40 hours of community service. 
- Costs for both counts to be paid through DOC.
Count 4- Deferred JOC
- "and all terms and conditions of this agreement" was added by the Court. 
DE is eligible for expungment upon successful completion. 
Probation can be transferred to Forest County. 
DE can appear by phone for probation review hearing. 
Agent to provide and update 5 days prior to probation review hearing. 
Probation review hearing scheduled for August 16, 2315 at 11:30 am.
Final pre-trial on May 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

If case is not resolved by 05-12-2015 DE may appear by phone. Bond continues.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
